intro: Euthamia microphylla, commonly known as the dwarf goldenrod, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and wetlands. It produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in late summer and early fall. Euthamia microphylla is known for its hardy nature and ability to thrive in various soil conditions.
